description: Manures and fertilizers may be applied in September – October. Fertilizers are applied 45 to 90 cm away from the trunk up to the peripheral leaf drip and incorporated. Annual 6th year Manures and 1 Year old increase onwards Fertilizers (Kg per tree) (Kg per tree) (Kg per tree) FYM 10.00 10.00 50 N 0.20 0.20 1.0 P 0.20 0.20 1.0 K 0.30 0.30 1.5
General recommendations for garden land, wetland banana and hill bananas.
Varieties other than Nendran 110* 35* 330* Nendran 150 90 300
Nendran 210 35 450 Rasthali 210 50 390 Poovan, Robusta 160 50 390 * For Tissue culture banana, apply 50% extra fertilizers at 2nd, 4th, 6th and 8th month after planting.

After forming semicircular basins on uphill side, apply 375 g of 40:30:40 NPK mixture, plus 130 g Muriate of Potash per clump per application during October, January and April. Preceding the chemical fertilizer application, apply Azospirillum and Phosphobacterium @ 20 gm each at planting and 5th month after planting. Apply N as Neem coated urea. Apply N and K in 3 splits on 3rd, 5th and 7th month, Phosphorous at 3rd month of planting. Apply 20 g in each of Azospirillum and Phosphobacteria during planting and five months after planting. (This should be applied prior to chemical fertilizer application). The fertigation technique must be followed for maximizing the productivity. Apply 200:30:300 g N: P O K O / plant using water soluble fertilizers along with 25 2 5: 2 litres of water/day. For economizing the cost of fertilizers, fertigate using normal

N is applied in two doses during March and October. FYM, P O and K O are to 2 5 2 be applied in October. Manures and I year (kg) Annual From 6th year Fertilizers increase (kg) (kg) FYM 10.000 5.000 30.000 N 0.200 0.100 0.600 P O 0.100 0.025 0.200 2 5 K O 0.100 0.040 0.300 2 Spray Zinc sulphate at the rate of 0.5% (500 g/100 lit of water) thrice in a year (March, July and October) after the emergence of new flushes.

Nitrogen has to be applied in two doses during March and October. However Farm yard manure, Phosphorousand Potash are to be applied in October. Manures and Annual From 6th year I year (kg) Fertilizers increase (kg) (kg) FYM 10.000 5.000 30.000 N 0.200 0.100 0.600 P O 0.100 0.025 0.200 2 5 K O 0.100 0.040 0.300 2 Manures are applied in the basin 70 cm away from the trunk and incorporated in the soil. Spray solution containing Sulphate of Zinc (0.5%), Manganese (0.05%), Iron (0.25%), Magnesium (0.5%), Boron (0.1%) and Molybdenum (0.003%) once in 3 months at the time of new flush production. In addition to that apply 50 g in each of Sulphate of Zinc, Manganese and Iron per tree per year.
a) For Palani Hills

description: & Fertilizers Kg/plant/year FYM 10.000 15.000 20.000 25.000 25.000 30.000 N 0.100 0.200 0.300 0.400 0.500 0.600 P 0.040 0.080 0.120 0.160 0.160 0.200 K 0.050 0.100 0.200 0.300 0.300 0.400 (Apply twice in a year during June and October) b) For Shervaroyan hills (for trees above 6 years old) Apply 700:375:600 g/tree of NPK along with VAM (Glomus fasiculatus) @ 1 kg/tree. Manures are to be applied in the basin at 70 cm away from the trunk and incorporated. Apply micronutrients as suggested for sweet orange. Apply agricultural lime or Dolomite at 4 kg/tree during January – February once in 2 – 3 years. This should not be combined with other chemical fertilizers.

description: Thompson 50 50 100 50 50 100 20 30 40 08 16 24 40 80 20 seedless Sonaka,

Sharad 50 50 100 50 50 100 20 40 60 08 16 24 40 80 20 seedless, Anab-e-Shahi The manures should be applied twice after pruning. Apply half the dose of potash immediately after pruning and the other half after 60 days of pruning. Foliar spray of 0.1% Boric acid + 0.2% ZnSO + 1.0% Urea twice before flowering and 10 4 days after first spray should be done to overcome nutrient deficiency.

FYM 50 Kg and one Kg in each of N, P and K per tree in two split doses during March and October should be applied. To increase the yield, spray Urea 1 % + Zinc sulphate 0.5% twice a year during March and October. To correct the boron deficiency (reduction in size of leaves and fruit cracking and hardening) spray 0.3% borax during flowering and fruit set stage.

crop_name: Micronutrients spray for controlling bronzing of leaves
description: A combined spray should be given containing ZnSO , MgSO and MnSo @ 4 4 4 0.5% and CuSO and FeSO @ 0.25 % plus Teepol @ 1ml per 5 lit of solution on 4 4 various stages viz., new flush, one month after, flowering and fruit set stages.

FYM 40-50 t/ha, N 16 g, P 4 g and K 12 g/plant in two equal splits at 6th and 12th month after planting. Apply as foliar spray 0.5% - 1.0 % sulphate of Zinc and Ferrous solutions at 15 days interval to overcome the deficiencies in the early crop phase.
Manures and fertilizers may be applied in September-October at 45 cm away from the trunk up to the leaf drip and incorporated. Annual 6th year Manures and 1 year old increase onwards

Apply FYM 10 Kg/plant as basal and 50 g in each of N, P and K per plant at bi- monthly intervals from the third month of planting after removing unwanted sex forms. Apply 20 g in each of Azospirillum and Phosphobacterium at planting again six months after planting.
Manures and 1st year 2nd to 5th year 6th year onwards Fertilizers (per plant) FYM 10 kg 20 kg 30 kg N 200 g 400 g 600 g P 100 g 250 g 500 g K 400 g 800 g 1200 g
The manures and fertilizers should be applied in two splits during May - June and September - October. Manures & Annual 6th year and 1 year old
(per plant / year) FYM 10 kg N 200 g P 500 g K 200 g Manuring should be done immediately after pruning.
For a bearing tree apply FYM 25 Kg, N 500 g and each one Kg of P and K per bearing tree.

Fertilizers (per 1st year 2nd year onwards plant/year) FYM 20 kg 50 kg N 200 g 500 g P 100 g 200 g K 200 g 500 g Manuring should be done immediately after pruning. Spray 2% KNO thrice at 3 monthly intervals in January, February and March.
Apply FYM 25 kg/tree, N 500 g and 1 kg in each of P and K per bearing tree.
Apply FYM 25 kg, N 500 g and 1 kg in each of P and K per bearing tree/year. The recommended dose of IFFCO complex is 4 kg and Urea is 0.22 Kg/tree.
Apply FYM 30 kg and 500 g of N and 1 kg in each of P and K for bearing tree during October – November.

crop_name: Name of the fruit with Manures and fertilizers
description: botanical name West Indian Cherry FYM 10 kg, N: 200 g, P: 50 g and (Malphigia punicifolia) K: 100 g/tree Annona FYM: 10 kg, Neem cake: 1 kg, N: 250 g, (Annona squamosa) P: 125 g and K: 250 g/tree (A. cherimnoya; A. reticulata) Apply 30 g each of Azotobacter, VAM, Azospirillum, Phosphobacteria and 50% of 125:65:125 g N, P O , K O per tree. 2 5 2 Lemon FYM: 30 kg N: 400 g, P: 200 g and (Citrus limon) K: 300 g/tree twice in a year Durian (Durio zebethinus) N: 38.3, P: 8.2 and K: 20.9 kg/ha (bearing tree) Avocado (Persea americana) FYM: 40-45 kg, Urea: 1 kg and Super phosphate: 1 kg Fig (Ficus carica ) FYM: 36 kg, Neem cake: 2.25 kg and Sulphate of Ammonia: 680 g Kiwi (Actinidia delicious) FYM: 20 kg (basal dose), 0.5 kg NPK mixture containing 15% N is applied each year. After 5 years, N: 850-900g, P: 500- 600g, K: 800-900g/vine Apricot (Prunus americana) FYM: 40 kg, N: 500g, P O : 250g and 2 5 K: 200g Bread fruit FYM: 25 kg and 7 : 10 : 5 NPK mixure @ (Artocarpus incise) 1-2 kg/plant Litchi FYM: 60 kg, N: 100 g, P: 40 g and K: 400 g (Litchi chinensis Sonner.) for 10 year old tree. Apply N in two split doses in February & April. FYM, P and K to be applied in December Mangosteen FYM: 75 kg, N: 1 kg, P: 0.8 kg and (Garcinia mangostana) K: 3.0 kg/tree Straw berry FYM: 3 kg/m², N: 8 g, P: 8 g and (Fragaria vesca) K: 8 g/plant during October and February
